siccom.gui

Class TimedDisplay2D

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • sim.display.Display2D
            • siccom.gui.TimedDisplay2D
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, sim.display.Manipulating2D, sim.engine.Steppable

    public class TimedDisplay2D
extends sim.display.Display2D
    This class implements a Display2D that will invoke a visual update periodically during simulation time instead after every or an amount of steps. This behaviour is advantageous when coupling the simulation time with real time, e.g. when a simulation shall simulate a real time process and every second of the real time process a visual update should occur.
    For implementing this behaviour this class uses an instance of the class TimedDisplayAlgorithm that is configured and will be called every step of the simulation. The method step(SimState) will be overwritten to invoke the method TimedDisplayAlgorithm.visualUpdate(SimState) that will return true if a visual update has to be performed; in that case the method step(SimState) of the superclass will be called (doing everything necessary for the visual update, this class has no idea how to perform it itself so we rely on the superclass). An instance of the class TimedDisplayAlgorithm can be configured in various ways so refer to TimedDisplayAlgorithm.
    The reason an instance of the class TimedDisplayAlgorithm is used lies in the single inheritance scheme of JAVA since no multiple inheritance is available. The very same algorithm for performing the periodic behaviour is used for the subclasses of Display2D and Display3D so the code has to maintained twice. Using a different class simplifies the implementation efforts for TimedDisplay2D and TimedDisplay3D.
    Author:
    hoehne

    • Constructor Detail

      • TimedDisplay2D

        public TimedDisplay2D(double width,
                      double height,
                      sim.display.GUIState simulation,
                      double firstUpdate,
                      double dTime,
                      boolean createOwnEvents)
        The constructor of this display.
        Parameters:
        width - The visual width, see Display2D.
        height - The visual height, see Display2D.
        simulation - The simulation, see Display2D.
        firstUpdate - The time of the first visual update. This simulation time has to elapsed first before a visual update will occur.
        dTime - The (minimum) time between two successive visual updates.
        createOwnEvents - Force a visual update even if no simulation progress occurred during two successive visual updates.

        The overwritten method of Display2D.step(SimState). The instance of TimedDisplayAlgorithm is asked if a visual update should occur.
